sn56.38:4.1: “Mendicants, as long as the moon and the sun don’t arise in the world, no great light or great radiance appears.
sn56.38:4.3: Day and night aren’t found, nor months and fortnights, nor seasons and years.
sn56.38:5.1: But when the moon and the sun arise in the world, a great light, a great radiance appears.
sn56.38:5.3: Day and night are found, and months and fortnights, and seasons and years.
sn56.38:5.4: In the same way, as long as the Realized One doesn’t arise in the world, no great light or great radiance appears.
sn56.38:5.6: There’s no explanation of the four noble truths, no teaching, advocating, establishing, clarifying, analyzing, and revealing them.
sn56.38:6.1: But when the Realized One arises in the world, a great light, a great radiance appears.
sn56.38:6.3: Then there’s the explanation of the four noble truths, the teaching, advocating, establishing, clarifying, analyzing, and revealing them.
sn56.38:6.5: The noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.38:7.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
